TopicTitle: Can I slap docking ports on anything or are there certain constraints? (pics inside)

Articles.Content:
Can I slap docking ports on anything I like so long as it is physically connected in some way with the craft?

Like so perhaps:
If you just want to connect ships together than they can be anywhere, I'm not sure if you need fuel flow to them for transferring fuel though.
The arrangement in your picture will work, though you may want to reinforce it with struts.
Thanks for the replies. Already modified the setup and introduced hinges between the truss and the fuselage like so:

I've heard that there are problems with certain parts if they're between the docking port and the root capsule. The octogonal cubic strut is one of the parts, I'm not sure about the girder struts you're using there. Has something to do with a bug or inability to reverse it's stacking when the ship reorganizes itself when it docks.
I got this thing into orbit and docked with my soon to be space station. Will be trying to dock onto the struts later this evening. I'll keep you apprised of any progress.

Yeah that should work, if it attaches anywhere and isn't clipping or obstructed it should work.

Also lol at those radial liquid engines pretending to be RCS thrusters. That's neat.

Had to push back my plans for a couple of days but finally got around to give it a go.

Here is the result:

So it does work! I even squeezed a rotating actuator between the truss and the docking port. Saves me the hassle of aligning the ship for docking at least on one axis.

OP, what exactly are you building there? That is an awful lot of RCS ports and (what looks like) your own custom LFO-powered control system. Nice!

But what is it?

Well the RCS ports and the LFO-powered control system (I assume you are talking about the Liquid Engine Thrusters - couldn't find any information on that abbreviation ) are merely a measure to enable maneuverability of my rocket during ascent and in vacuum since I am employing parts with a 5m diameter. The purpose of this whole station comes down to being a refueling station primarily. I haven't really put much thought in the big picture.

Thanks for noticing. Didn't know Its the novelty you make it out to be. Especially since there is a mod around that adds "Throttle Control Steering" to VTOL engines: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/draktec-vtol-engines/

Without that mod any efforts of mine in that direction would have been fruitless.

I like the sound of that mod.. Though it seriously needs to be vanilla... Like why do we have to run the engines all at the same throttle? VTOL would be so much easier that way.

Using this mod once you flip the "Throttle Control Steering" switch on your VTOL engines they work as long as the actual engines are activated. They do not depend on RCS activated nor on any sort of throttling. So what you do is you assign two action groups to actually putting the engines in "Throttle Control Steering" and one action group for toggling the engines. That way you have full control. Its a bit of chore going through the action group list with a lot of those engines even when placed in symmetry > 1.
